unnormalised: New Delhi – Preparations are underway for the upcoming G20 summit, scheduled to commence on 09/09/2024, causing significant logistical adjustments across the capital. The Ministry of External Affairs confirmed that delegations from 20 member nations, along with several guest countries, will be arriving between 07/09/2024 and 08/09/2024. Extensive security measures are being implemented, with over 130,000 personnel deployed throughout Delhi and surrounding areas.
normalised: New Delhi – Preparations are underway for the upcoming G-twenty summit, scheduled to commence on ninth september two thousand and twenty four, causing significant logistical adjustments across the capital. The Ministry of External Affairs confirmed that delegations from twenty member nations, along with several guest countries, will be arriving between seventh september two thousand and twenty four and eighth september two thousand and twenty four. Extensive security measures are being implemented, with over one hundred and thirty thousand personnel deployed throughout Delhi and surrounding areas.

unnormalised: Traffic restrictions will be in effect from 00:01 hours on 09/09/2024 until 23:59 hours on 10/09/2024, particularly affecting routes leading to Pragati Maidan, the venue for the summit. Commuters are advised to use alternative routes or public transportation to avoid delays. The Delhi Metro will operate at full capacity, with increased frequency during peak hours. Schools and offices in the New Delhi district will remain closed on 08/09/2024 to further ease traffic congestion.
normalised: Traffic restrictions will be in effect from zero zero zero one hours on ninth september two thousand and twenty four until twenty three fifty nine hours on tenth september two thousand and twenty four, particularly affecting routes leading to Pragati Maidan, the venue for the summit. Commuters are advised to use alternative routes or public transportation to avoid delays. The Delhi Metro will operate at full capacity, with increased frequency during peak hours. Schools and offices in the New Delhi district will remain closed on eighth september two thousand and twenty four to further ease traffic congestion.

unnormalised: The summit's inaugural session is slated to begin at 09:30 AM IST on 09/09/2024, focusing on issues related to global economic stability and sustainable development. Prime Minister Narendra Modi is expected to address the delegates, outlining India's vision for inclusive growth and multilateral cooperation. Bilateral meetings between various heads of state are also scheduled to take place on the sidelines of the main event, beginning at 14:00 hrs.
normalised: The summit's inaugural session is slated to begin at nine thirty A-M I-S-T on ninth september two thousand and twenty four, focusing on issues related to global economic stability and sustainable development. Prime Minister Narendra Modi is expected to address the delegates, outlining India's vision for inclusive growth and multilateral cooperation. Bilateral meetings between various heads of state are also scheduled to take place on the sidelines of the main event, beginning at fourteen zero zero hours.

unnormalised: Cultural events showcasing India's rich heritage have been planned for the evening of 09/09/2024, starting at 7:00 PM. These events will be held at various locations across the city and are designed to offer the visiting dignitaries a glimpse into the country's diverse traditions. Strict security protocols will be observed at these venues.
normalised: Cultural events showcasing India's rich heritage have been planned for the evening of ninth september two thousand and twenty four, starting at seven zero zero P-M. These events will be held at various locations across the city and are designed to offer the visiting dignitaries a glimpse into the country's diverse traditions. Strict security protocols will be observed at these venues.

unnormalised: The summit is expected to conclude at approximately 17:00 hrs on 10/09/2024, with a joint statement outlining the key outcomes and commitments made by the member nations. Post-summit briefings will be held by various ministries on 11/09/2024 to provide detailed information on the specific agreements reached during the event.
normalised: The summit is expected to conclude at approximately seventeen zero zero hours on tenth september two thousand and twenty four, with a joint statement outlining the key outcomes and commitments made by the member nations. Post-summit briefings will be held by various ministries on eleventh september two thousand and twenty four to provide detailed information on the specific agreements reached during the event.
